intro: Diasperus ellipticus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. Diasperus ellipticus is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
